author: Staff Reporter
text:
The police clamped locks on wheels of motorcycles parked on collectorate premises and collected fine from violators in Salem on Monday. —Photo: E. Lakshmi Narayanan

The Traffic Wing of the city police registered case against 11 motorists and collected fine of Rs. 1,100 for parking their vehicles at ‘no-parking’ area on the collectorate premises.

During the weekly grievances day grievances redress meeting at collectorate held on every Monday large number of people from across the city come to the collectorate to submit petitions.

The parking facility available is also insufficient for all the vehicles as motorists park their vehicles haphazardly.

This blocked the free flow of traffic as the administration asked the traffic police to take action against unauthorised parking. Despite, the cancellation of grievances redress meeting due to election, the public continue to visit the collectorate for various works. Hence, vehicles are parked along the road in the premises.

The city police on Monday clamped locks on wheels of two-wheelers that were parked on the collectorate premises. Officials said that during the one hour drive, as many as 11 motorists were fined for violating the rules.

Drive to continue

They said surprise drive would continue in the coming weeks and asked the motorists to park their vehicles only in the allotted space.
title: Motorists fined for illegal parking on collectorate premises
